spec.prompt: A technical diagram showing spatial interpolation on a semiconductor wafer using Kriging/Gaussian Process. Three panels arranged left to right with arrows between them. LEFT panel: a circular 300mm wafer outline with only 9 scattered measurement points marked as bold colored dots (showing CD values like 19.8nm, 20.1nm, 20.3nm etc.), the rest of the wafer is empty/gray. CENTER panel: the same wafer now filled with a continuous color heatmap (blue=low CD ~19.5nm to red=high CD ~20.5nm) generated by Kriging interpolation from those 9 points, showing a smooth Center-high, Edge-low pattern. RIGHT panel: the 'uncertainty map' showing prediction confidence - areas near measurement points are dark blue (low uncertainty, Â±0.05nm), while areas far from measurement points (especially wafer edge) are orange-red (high uncertainty, Â±0.3nm), with a note 'High uncertainty â†’ recommend additional measurement'. Include a colorbar for each panel. Clean technical illustration style.
